meta.description: High-level design language describing the visual style, structure, and interaction patterns of the Hot33Cozy tea ritual app. Optimized for iOS 16+, dark UI, and SwiftUI implementation.

brand.tone: Warm, cozy, ritual-focused tea companion with a premium but approachable feel.
brand.visualStyle: Dark mode first, strong contrast between warm accent colors and desaturated dark backgrounds. Components are rectangular with subtle rounding and clear, crisp edges. Minimal decoration, focus on clarity and hierarchy.
principles: Prioritize clarity and legibility over decoration.
Use strong color only for primary actions, focus elements, and time-sensitive feedback (timer, charts).
Maintain consistent spacing rhythm and alignment across all screens.
Highlight ritual and repetition: repeat layouts across Timer, Recipe Book, Statistics, and My Rituals.
Support quick scanning: bold titles, muted subtitles, clear dividers, and consistent iconography.

primaryRed.usage: Primary action buttons, timer ring, chart bars, key highlights that indicate heat, time, or important rituals.

accentYellow.usage: Timer progress highlight, selected tab icon outlines, emphasis on statistics and active states.

backgroundMain.usage: Main screen background behind all content.

backgroundSurface.usage: Cards, bottom navigation container, timer panel, lists, and input surfaces.

backgroundEmphasis.usage: Elevated elements like the daily deal banner, active list sections, and hero surfaces behind images.

divider.usage: Thin separator lines under section titles, text fields, and as structural horizontal rules.

textPrimary.usage: Primary text such as titles, main labels, and numbers.

textSecondary.usage: Subtitles, metadata like temperature and brewing time, secondary labels.

textMuted.usage: Placeholder text, helper labels, less important timestamps.

tabIconInactive.usage: Stroke and fill color for inactive tab icons.

tabIconActive.usage: Outline and symbol accent for the active tab icon.

danger.usage: Destructive actions such as swipe-to-delete in lists.

overlayScrim.usage: Semi-transparent overlay for modal elements when needed.

usageGuidelines: Use primaryRed sparingly for high-value actions (Start, Stop, Save) and timer-related visualizations.
Limit accentYellow primarily to timer progress, selected tab indicators, and statistics emphasis to avoid color noise.
Keep the overall screen dark. Avoid pure black; use backgroundMain and backgroundSurface for a softer, less harsh dark mode.
Ensure sufficient contrast between textPrimary/textSecondary and background surfaces for legibility.
Use divider lines to structure content vertically instead of heavy borders or cards.

typography.family: SF Pro Rounded / SF Pro Text (system). Rounded for large display numbers and key headings, Text for lists and details.

displayTimer.usage: Main timer value in the circular timer, e.g., 05:00.

h1ScreenTitle.usage: Top navigation title centered on each screen, e.g., Timer, Statistics, Recipe Book.

h2SectionTitle.usage: Section titles like Title, Notes, Ingredients, Description, Today, Yesterday.

h3CardTitle.usage: Recipe titles inside cards and list rows.

bodyPrimary.usage: Standard body copy such as notes, descriptions, and list subtitles.

bodySecondary.usage: Secondary metadata like temperature, brewing time, and timestamps.

labelSmall.usage: Caps labels for segmented controls (Day, Week, Month) and small UI labels.

buttonLabel.usage: Start/Stop/Save button labels with strong emphasis.

guidelines: Use one primary type family (SF Pro) to keep the interface cohesive.
Limit the number of weights per screen to two (e.g., semibold and regular) to avoid visual noise.
Timer numbers should be larger and allowed generous breathing room to stand out.
Use uppercase or title case consistently for labels like Day, Week, Month, and button titles.
Maintain consistent line height and spacing between section labels and their associated content.

rules: Horizontal screen margins use lg (16) on phones for all primary content blocks.
Vertical spacing between unrelated sections (e.g., Timer and Title area) should use xl or xxl.
Spacing between label and value (e.g., Title label and its text) should use sm or md for tight hierarchy.
Bottom tab bar uses minimal vertical padding to feel compact but remains touch-friendly.
Buttons maintain generous top margin from preceding fields and bottom margin above the tab bar.

navigationBar.leadingItem: Back arrow or none depending on context.
navigationBar.trailingItem: Plus icon for adding new rituals or recipes.
guidelines: Keep the navigation bar visually light with a thin bottom divider.
Center the title, avoid large icons in the bar.
Use SF Symbol icons with consistent stroke weight for back and add actions.

bottomTabBar.layout: Five equally spaced tabs with icon on top, label below.
guidelines: Tab bar floats visually above the screen edges, with rounded corners and padding from screen border.
Active tab is indicated by accentYellow icon outline and label color; inactive tabs are monochrome gray.
Icons should be outline-style, simple, and consistent in stroke width.
Timer circle is centrally aligned and occupies roughly the upper half of the safe area.
Title and Notes fields sit in a vertical stack with clear underlines, occupying full width minus standard margins.
Primary button spans nearly full width with generous height and strong color contrast.
Segmented control is centered, pill-shaped, and clearly differentiated between active and inactive segments.
Bar chart uses strong red bars with yellow outlines or accents against a dark background.
Statistics list uses alternating sections separated by dashed or thin dividers.

sections: Navigation bar with title My Rituals
guidelines: Daily deal is a prominent horizontal card with an image on the right and text on the left on a red-orange gradient background.
List rows show title, context (e.g., After Yoga), and time aligned to the right.
Swipe-to-delete reveals a full-height red delete action aligned to the right.
Use a two-column grid with consistent card aspect ratio (portrait) and equal spacing.
Cards have a yellow outline when part of the main recipe grid and a more muted outline in other contexts.
Each card shows image, title, and a small temperature/time strip with icons at the bottom.

sections: Navigation bar with share and favorite icons
guidelines: Hero image spans full width above the fold with subtle corner radii matched to the rest of the app.
Ingredients are presented as a simple text list with bullet-like dots or line breaks.
Description is numbered to emphasize stepwise ritual behavior.

primary.shape: Full-width rounded rectangle with medium radius.
primary.shadow: Subtle soft shadow or inner shading for depth.

iconCircle.shape: Circle or rounded square with subtle border.
iconCircle.usage: Add photo, add recipe, navigation close/back icons.

timerRing.animation: Smooth continuous stroke drawing for countdown progress.
guidelines: Keep the inner circle clean with only the time and a horizontal divider line.
Fully completed circle uses red ring only when timer is idle; yellow progress overlays during countdown.
Timer ring should feel bold and central to the screen; avoid additional badges or icons inside.

segmentedControl.shape: Rounded rectangle pill container housing three segments.
segmentedControl.layout: Segments sit flush with each other, equal width, with subtle outer stroke.

tabBarItem.iconStyle: Outline SF Symbol or custom icon with uniform stroke.

guidelines: Label sits above the value field, left-aligned, with clear separation using the underline.
Fields do not have filled backgrounds; rely on underline and alignment for affordance.
Use consistent width across forms to align all fields vertically.

listRowRitual.layout: Title and subtitle stacked left; time aligned right vertically centered.

guidelines: Bars are thick enough to feel substantial, with minimal spacing.
Use yellow as a subtle accent for outlines or key bars, not for every element.
Y-axis labels can be simplified to small numbers along the right edge for a technical look.
Use subtle, functional motion focused on timers, progress, and state changes.
Timer progress animates smoothly along the ring; avoid bounce or excessive easing.
Button taps shrink slightly and darken to convey press feedback.
Segmented control and tab bar transitions should be quick and direct, without heavy spring animations.
List interactions like swipe-to-delete use standard iOS patterns without custom motion.
Ensure adequate contrast between primary text and dark backgrounds.
Maintain minimum 44x44pt touch targets for all interactive elements, including icons and hearts.
Support Dynamic Type by allowing fonts to scale while maintaining relative hierarchy.
Avoid relying on color alone to indicate selection; use shape and weight (e.g., filled segment, underline) where possible.
